p: Chemical composition. Relevant secondary metabolites in the seed include large quantities of fixed oil (30%â€“45%; especially linoleic and oleic acids), various triterpenoids, including saponins; essential oil, with a relatively high concentration of thymoquinone (2-isopropyl-5-methyl-1,4-benzoquinone), which is also a key therapeutically relevant of the fixed oil, where it can be found in concentrations varying from 3.5 to 8.7 mg/g of fixed oil ( Lutterodt et al., 2010). Thymoquinone is not found in relevant concentrations in aqueous preparations.
